title: Branding Sri Lanka as a better tourist destination underway: Minister
byline: Branding Sri Lanka as a new tourist destination is underway with tenders having already been called for proposals, Minister of Tourism and External Affairs Vijitha Hearth told Parliament today.

title: IGP directs action against officers linked to Ashoka Ranwala accident
byline: Investigations have revealed that several police officers, including the OIC, the Traffic OIC of the Sapugaskanda Police Station had failed to properly discharge their duties in relation to a road accident involving former Speaker and MP Ashoka Ranwala.

title: How a gold regulatory authority could spark Sri Lanka’s next economic revolution
byline: Amidst the complex challenges of economic stabilisation, a bold and transformative policy proposition is gaining traction among industry leaders and economists: the establishment of a dedicated Gold Regulatory Authority (GRA) coupled with strategic support for the gem and jewellery sector.

title: Total lendings by  banks, non-banking institutions in 2024 exceeds Rs 1 trillion: Ravi K
byline: The total lendings by commercial banks and non-banking institutions in 2024 has exceeded Rs 1 trillion, Opposition MP Ravi Karunanayake told Parliament today.

title: SL’s mineral export potential is US $ 778 million whereas realised amount is US $ 389 million
byline: Sri Lanka’s mineral export potential is as much as US $ 778 million annually where the realized amount is only US $ 389 million as estimated by the ITC Export Potential Map, a report compiled by the Pathfinder Foundation says.

title: Spill gates opened at three Mahaweli reservoirs
byline: The spill gates of the Victoria, Randenigala and Rantembe reservoirs have been opened, the Mahaweli Authority said.

title: “We were trembling, fearing it would crash while flying over our houses” - eyewitness
byline: “We became highly suspicious when a large passenger aircraft was flying unusually low and circling several times in the sky. Because of that, we paid close attention. Everyone in our family went up to the upper floor of the house and observed the aircraft. We were all afraid that it would crash. Many people in the village had woken up and were watching the sky.

title: Pay or not to pay? Cabraal has to pay
byline: The Colombo High Court on December 10 permitted the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) to withdraw the indictments filed against former Central Bank Governor Ajith Nivard Cabraal in connection with the controversial Greek bond transaction, subject to stringent conditions recommended by the CIABOC.

title: Showery conditions to persist across several parts
byline: Prevailing showery conditions are expected to continue over the Northern and Eastern parts of the island due to the influence of an Easterly wave, according to the Department of Meteorology.

title: Nathan Lyon moves to second on Australia’s Test wicket list
byline: Off-spinner passes Glenn McGrath after early impact in Adelaide Ashes Test, with only Shane Warne ahead for Australian bowlers.

title: England to hold ICC talks after Carey DRS error
byline: England will hold discussions with cricket’s governing body with the aim of improving decision-making technology following a controversial error on the opening day of the third Ashes Test.

title: Three arrested for killing of wild elephant in Mihintale
byline: Three individuals were arrested yesterday evening (17) by officers of the Mihintale Police in connection with the killing of a wild elephant in the Seeppukulama area.

title: India v South Africa 4th T20 abandoned due to fog
byline: The fourth T20 international between India and South Africa was abandoned without a ball being bowled due to dense fog in the northern Indian city of Lucknow on Wednesday.

title: Take the disaster seriously: Namal
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP Namal Rajapaksa today urged the government to be more serious and focus on providing relief to the disaster affected people.

title: Myanmar regime claims Aung San Suu Kyi ‘in good health’ despite son’s fears
byline: Military-ruled Myanmar has said the country’s jailed Nobel Peace Prize laureate Aung San Suu Kyi is “in good health” amid concerns about the health of the pro-democracy leader who was removed from power by a coup in 2021.

title: Damaged roads will be restored with soil protection: Deputy Minister
byline: Claiming that the country’s road network has been constructed without paying attention to soil protection, Deputy Minister Prasanna Gunasena said today that the government is planning to restore the damaged roads with soil protection.

title: Krrish deal case against Namal fixed for February
byline: The case against Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa over the alleged Krrish deal was today fixed for February 16 by the Colombo High Court.

title: Ravi K recalls NITF disaster insurance as Ditwah exposes gaps in protection
byline: As Sri Lanka reels from the devastation caused by Cyclone Ditwah, former Finance Minister and current MP Ravi Karunanayake has reminded the government that a national disaster insurance mechanism once implemented through the National Insurance Trust Fund (NITF) could have significantly reduced the financial and humanitarian fallout.

title: Meteorology Department officials under virtual office arrest: Sajith
byline: Officials of the Meteorology Department are virtually under office arrest as they are not allowed to talk to any outsiders or to meet anyone, Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa told Parliament today.

title: Former Deputy Minister Muthukumarana, ex-MP Adhikari pass away
byline: Former Deputy Minister representing the Anuradhapura District, S.C. Muthukumarana has passed away due to an illness.

title: Three suspects remanded over Mihintale elephant death case
byline: Three suspects connected to the death of an elephant in the Seeppukulam area have been remanded till December 24 by the Anuradhapura Magistrate’s Court.

title: Lawyer discharged with warning after admitting professional misconduct
byline: An Attorney-at-Law was today discharged subject to a formal warning by the Supreme Court after pleading guilty to an act of professional misconduct, with the court cautioning him to exercise greater diligence in the future to avoid conduct that could undermine the integrity of the legal profession and the administration of justice.

title: Cyclone Ditwah floods pollute 200 nautical miles of Sri Lankan coastline
byline: The Marine Environmental Protection Authority (MEPA) has reported severe ocean pollution along 200 nautical miles of Sri Lanka’s coastline following landslides and floods caused by Cyclone Ditwah. Tons of organic plant debris and other waste have been washed into the ocean, posing a serious threat to the country’s fishing industry, MEPA Chairman Samantha Gunasekara warned.

title: No gas shortage, says Vijitha
byline: Refuting claims that a gas shortage is imminent, Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath said today that there will be no shortage, as the first shipment under the new supplier, Geogas Trading SA of Switzerland, is scheduled to arrive in Sri Lanka by January 5, 2026.

title: US announces $11bn weapons sale to Taiwan
byline: The Trump administration has announced a huge arms sale worth around $11bn (£8.2bn) to Taiwan, which includes advanced rocket launchers, self-propelled howitzers and a variety of missiles.

title: European Union provides over €2.35Mn in humanitarian aid to Sri Lanka
byline: The European Union has allocated more than €2.35 million in humanitarian assistance to Sri Lanka in response to the impact of Tropical Cyclone Ditwah, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: 397 elephants die in Sri Lanka in 2025, human-elephant conflict a major cause
byline: The Department of Wildlife Conservation (DWC) has reported a total of 397 elephant deaths in 2025, with the majority linked to human-elephant conflicts, underscoring the growing severity of the issue across the country.

title: Five arrested with illegally imported cigarettes worth Rs. 330 Mn
byline: Five suspects, including three employees of the Sri Lanka Ports Authority, have been arrested with a consignment of illegally imported cigarettes valued at approximately Rs. 330 million.

title: Public urged to exercise caution as landslide risk rises
byline: In light of the increased risk of landslides in areas showing early signs of slope failure, the National Building Research Organization (NBRO) has urged the public to exercise caution, particularly in Udadumbara in the Kandy District.
